channel.title: Programming in SMF: Rep +/- Count
channel.description:
Greetings!
It has been a while since I was last active on Moparscape. I hope all is well. :)
I have a question regarding reputation/karma count on SMF forums. Before, reputation on Mopar sites was added and subtracted from an overall number, whereas in the original SMF software, two separate numbers are added and subtracted (ex. Reputation: +9/-3).
How do you program reputation to work as it did on Mopar sites? Thank you for the help!
With warm regards,
TheCyberMan

item.title: Programming in SMF: Rep +/- Count
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:533248”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=652043.msg4374603#msg4374603 date=1381711998]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/Karma.phps

pretty useless now I guess
[/quote]that won’t work on newer versions; anyways, someone released a weighted karma mod for smf.

Shouldn’t be hard to compare and update it.[/quote]Again, really no need as a modification was released through SMF for a weighted karma system.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming in SMF: Rep +/- Count
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

That is exactly what I needed, iCreatedHorror, thank you! I cannot believe I did not notice that setting this entire time. :palm:

Read full topic

item.title: Programming in SMF: Rep +/- Count
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

By default, SMF can display a single total value.
http://wiki.simplemachines.org/smf/Features_and_Options#Karma

Read full topic
